main event: Multiple witnesses observed an unusual atmospheric phenomenon while traveling between Watertown and Webster, South Dakota, on June 30, 1948.
interesting points: Witnesses included Mr. ████████, his wife, and several others who reported the object was observed for over two hours., The object appeared to change shape and was initially thought to be a star., The altitude of the object was estimated at approximately 10 miles., Witnesses described the object as having a polished aluminum color and it disintegrated into smaller pieces., There was no sound detected during the sighting and the weather conditions were clear with wind velocities at 3 MPH.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object described as a cluster of parts
witness description: Mr. ████████ is a chemical engineer and amateur astronomer, along with his wife and several other observers.
